title: Eiffel Tower, Paris, France
notes: Steel art. Tall, noticeable from any place in Paris, landmark and significant icon of the city. This Paris sunset holds a particular place in my travel voyages. Stitched strong to my memories, the sunset I witnessed sitting across the lawn in front of the tower, having few cold ones, beats any of my southern californian sunsets.
alt: Sunset at Eiffel Tower in Paris, France

title: Boston, Massachusetts
alt: Otter Cliffs, Acadia National Park in Maine

title: Seattle, Washington
notes: For one of the best views of Seattle head to Kerry Park. It's small and is essentially a viewpoint that looks out over Seattle Center, Downtown Seattle and Elliott Bay. The neighborhood is quite wealthy and there are some beautiful homes in the area. One of the best places to stroll around on the regular Seattle evenings.

title: Public Market of Seattle, Washington
notes: One of the few authentic farmer's markets in the United States. This is a working market that doubles as a tourist attraction. It is filled with food and flower stalls. I particularly enjoyed seeing the catch of the day, given that I don't live in the Pacific NW. It also has artisans who ply their trade right in front of you. Note that I call this a 'working marketing' before I alluded to it being a place tourists might enjoy. Pike had a nice blend of 'real' and 'attraction'

alt: Flower Stalls, Pike Place Market, Seattle, Washington

title: First Starbucks, Seattle, Washington
notes: The Original Starbucks, located near the waterfront in Seattle’s Pike Place Market, isn’t the modest 45-year-old sign. This Starbucks is where it all began. The line may be crazy long, the coffee is the same as any other Starbucks, but you go there for the experience. It is one of the most surreal experience to hear the history of the company and order a drink from the very first Starbucks.

title: Yarmouth, Cape Cod
notes: One of the best boardwalk in the Cape Cod region in Massachusetts. Sunsets at Gray's Beach at Yarmouth are one the most spectacular and breathtaking events. A hidden Cape Cod gem.
alt: Gray's Beach at Yarmouth in Cape Cod, Massachusetts

title: Parker River National Wildlife Refuge, Massachusetts
notes: Located along the northeast coast of Massachusetts, Parker River National Wildlife Refuge has special significance and value to migratory birds. This photograph is during one of the many birding adventutes I did during my years in Boston catching the glimpses of wildlife.
alt: Birding Adventure at Parker River National Wildlife Refuge, Massachusetts

title: Deer Island in Boston, Massachusetts
notes: Deer Island has been one of the places that is stitched in my core memory. I have always loved a good sunrise, and have often went distance to catch a good one. When I lived back in Boston, catching a good sunrise at Deer Island was one of the many favorite things I did frequently.

title: Cape Cod, Massachusetts
notes: Sandwich in Cape Cod, Massachusetts has been one of my most favorite places around the Cape Cod region in Massachusetts. This little boardwalk starts from nowhere and is a beautiful spot to stroll above the marsh and eventually end up on a lovely beach with dunes and protected areas for endangered birds’ nesting habitats.

title: Otter Cliffs, Acadia National Park in Maine
notes: One of the coldest and finest sunrise I have witnessed so far. This is from Otter Cliff inside Acadia National Park during the month of January. It was cold enough that my phone's battery died in few minutes. Witnessing the sun coming out in that temperature, standing in 2 layers of warm jackets trying to keep my hands warm enough and holding the camera steady enough to get one nice shot, one hell of an adventure it was. Glad that picture turned out to be a good one in the end.
alt: Otter Cliffs, Acadia National Park in Maine

title: Acadia National Park, Maine

alt: Otter Cliffs, Acadia National Park in Maine

title: First Light
notes: Cadillac Mountain gave me the most beautiful sunrise of my life in 2017. Cadillac Mountain is one of the first places in USA to witness a sunrise. I woke up so insanely early and sat in the cold until that sun rose. It was beyond worth it. The anticipation of waking up early, feeling the morning chill sink into your bones as you wait, and the excitement of the horizon changing colors is like nothing else.
alt: Sunrise at Cadillac Mountain in Acadia National Park

title: Bar Harbor, Maine
notes: One of the coldest and finest sunrise I have witnessed so far. This is from Otter Cliff inside Acadia National Park during the month of January. alt: Otter Cliffs, Acadia National Park in Maine

title: Mount Rainier, Washington
notes: An active volcano, Mount Rainier is the most glaciated peak in the contiguous U.S.A., spawning five major rivers. At a height of 14,410 feet, Mount Rainier is the highest volcanic peak in the contiguous United States. Because of the unpredictable weather climate in the state of washington, you hardly get to see the mountain in all of its glory, but on those couple of clear days when you get to see the mountain, you realize the sheer beauty of it.

title: Reflection Lake, Mount Rainier, Washington
notes: The views of Mt Rainier from reflection lakes are legendary and with good reason. This is one of the most picturesque area in Mount Rainier National Park. Try to catch the lake in the early morning or evening when the water is still.  If the sky is clear you’ll have an excellent chance to view Mount Rainier reflecting in these beautiful subalpine lakes.

title: Picture Lake, Washington
notes: Picture Lake is the most incredible sight in the entire of Washington. Located in Northern Washington, Picture Lake is about a 3 hour drive from Seattle. With Mount Shuksan in the background and the wildflowers in the foreground, Picture lake is, well, as pretty as, a post card picture!
